1.name: Bulbasaur
descriptions: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.
There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.

2.name: Ivysaur
descriptions: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.
When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

3.name: Venusaur
descriptions: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.
Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

4.name: Charmander
descriptions: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

5.name: Charmeleon
descriptions: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

6.name: Charizard
descriptions: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

7.name: Squirtle
descriptions: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.

8.name: Wartortle
descriptions: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.
It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

9.name: Blastoise
descriptions: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.
It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.

10.name: Caterpie
descriptions: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

11.name: Metapod
descriptions: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.
It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.

12.name: Butterfree
descriptions: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.
In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

13.name: Weedle
descriptions: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

14.name: Kakuna
descriptions: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

15.name: Beedrill
descriptions: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

16.name: Pidgey
descriptions: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

17.name: Pidgeotto
descriptions: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

18.name: Pidgeot
descriptions: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

19.name: Rattata
descriptions: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

20.name: Raticate
descriptions: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

21.name: Spearow
descriptions: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

22.name: Fearow
descriptions: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.
A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

23.name: Ekans
descriptions: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

24.name: Arbok
descriptions: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.
The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

25.name: Pikachu
descriptions: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.
When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

26.name: Raichu
descriptions: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

27.name: Sandshrew
descriptions: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.

28.name: Sandslash
descriptions: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.

29.name: Nidoran♀
descriptions: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.
Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

30.name: Nidorina
descriptions: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.
The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.

31.name: Nidoqueen
descriptions: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.
Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.

32.name: Nidoran♂
descriptions: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.
The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

33.name: Nidorino
descriptions: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.
With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.

34.name: Nidoking
descriptions: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.
When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

35.name: Clefairy
descriptions: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.
It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

36.name: Clefable
descriptions: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.
A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

37.name: Vulpix
descriptions: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

38.name: Ninetales
descriptions: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

39.name: Jigglypuff
descriptions: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

40.name: Wigglytuff
descriptions: The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it can’t stop touching it.
It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

41.name: Zubat
descriptions: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.
It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

42.name: Golbat
descriptions: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.
It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.

43.name: Oddish
descriptions: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

44.name: Gloom
descriptions: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

45.name: Vileplume
descriptions: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

46.name: Paras
descriptions: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

47.name: Parasect
descriptions: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

48.name: Venonat
descriptions: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.

49.name: Venomoth
descriptions: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

50.name: Diglett
descriptions: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

51.name: Dugtrio
descriptions: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

52.name: Meowth
descriptions: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.
All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

53.name: Persian
descriptions: It has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. This is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

54.name: Psyduck
descriptions: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

55.name: Golduck
descriptions: It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow-moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

56.name: Mankey
descriptions: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.
It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

57.name: Primeape
descriptions: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

58.name: Growlithe
descriptions: It’s very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.
It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

59.name: Arcanine
descriptions: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can’t help but grovel before it.
An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

60.name: Poliwag
descriptions: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

61.name: Poliwhirl
descriptions: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

62.name: Poliwrath
descriptions: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

63.name: Abra
descriptions: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

64.name: Kadabra
descriptions: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.
Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

65.name: Alakazam
descriptions: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.
It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

66.name: Machop
descriptions: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

67.name: Machoke
descriptions: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.
Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

68.name: Machamp
descriptions: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

69.name: Bellsprout
descriptions: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

70.name: Weepinbell
descriptions: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

71.name: Victreebel
descriptions: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

72.name: Tentacool
descriptions: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.
Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

73.name: Tentacruel
descriptions: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

74.name: Geodude
descriptions: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

75.name: Graveler
descriptions: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

76.name: Golem
descriptions: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.
Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

77.name: Ponyta
descriptions: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.
It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

78.name: Rapidash
descriptions: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.
This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

79.name: Slowpoke
descriptions: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

80.name: Slowbro
descriptions: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokémon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

81.name: Magnemite
descriptions: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.
The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

82.name: Magneton
descriptions: They’re formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

83.name: Farfetch'd
descriptions: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

84.name: Doduo
descriptions: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

85.name: Dodrio
descriptions: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

86.name: Seel
descriptions: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

87.name: Dewgong
descriptions: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

88.name: Grimer
descriptions: When two of these Pokémon’s bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

89.name: Muk
descriptions: It’s so stinky! Muk’s body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
It’s thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

90.name: Shellder
descriptions: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

91.name: Cloyster
descriptions: When attacked, it launches its spikes in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

92.name: Gastly
descriptions: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

93.name: Haunter
descriptions: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

94.name: Gengar
descriptions: Hiding in people’s shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey’s shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

95.name: Onix
descriptions: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

96.name: Drowzee
descriptions: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children’s are much tastier.

97.name: Hypno
descriptions: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

98.name: Krabby
descriptions: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

99.name: Kingler
descriptions: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

100.name: Voltorb
descriptions: It’s usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.
It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

101.name: Electrode
descriptions: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of the Bomb Ball.
The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

102.name: Exeggcute
descriptions: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

103.name: Exeggutor
descriptions: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.
Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.

104.name: Cubone
descriptions: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.

105.name: Marowak
descriptions: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.
This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.

106.name: Hitmonlee
descriptions: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

107.name: Hitmonchan
descriptions: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.

108.name: Lickitung
descriptions: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.

109.name: Koffing
descriptions: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

110.name: Weezing
descriptions: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.

111.name: Rhyhorn
descriptions: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

112.name: Rhydon
descriptions: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

113.name: Chansey
descriptions: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

114.name: Tangela
descriptions: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.
Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.

115.name: Kangaskhan
descriptions: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.
Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.

116.name: Horsea
descriptions: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.

117.name: Seadra
descriptions: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.
It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.

118.name: Goldeen
descriptions: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

119.name: Seaking
descriptions: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

120.name: Staryu
descriptions: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.

121.name: Starmie
descriptions: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.

122.name: Mr. Mime
descriptions: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.
The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.

123.name: Scyther
descriptions: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

124.name: Jynx
descriptions: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.
In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.

125.name: Electabuzz
descriptions: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.
Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.

126.name: Magmar
descriptions: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.
Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.

127.name: Pinsir
descriptions: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.

128.name: Tauros
descriptions: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

129.name: Magikarp
descriptions: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

130.name: Gyarados
descriptions: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

131.name: Lapras
descriptions: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

132.name: Ditto
descriptions: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can’t maintain its disguise.

133.name: Eevee
descriptions: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.
Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

134.name: Vaporeon
descriptions: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can’t be seen when it melts away into water.
It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.

135.name: Jolteon
descriptions: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

136.name: Flareon
descriptions: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

137.name: Porygon
descriptions: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.

138.name: Omanyte
descriptions: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.
Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.

139.name: Omastar
descriptions: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.
Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.

140.name: Kabuto
descriptions: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.
This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.

141.name: Kabutops
descriptions: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.
Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.

142.name: Aerodactyl
descriptions: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.
This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.

143.name: Snorlax
descriptions: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.
It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

144.name: Articuno
descriptions: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.
It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.

145.name: Zapdos
descriptions: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.
This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.

146.name: Moltres
descriptions: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.
It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.

147.name: Dratini
descriptions: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

148.name: Dragonair
descriptions: It is called the divine Pokémon. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.
They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

149.name: Dragonite
descriptions: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.

150.name: Mewtwo
descriptions: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

151.name: Mew
descriptions: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

152.name: Chikorita
descriptions: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

153.name: Bayleef
descriptions: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

154.name: Meganium
descriptions: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.
The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

155.name: Cyndaquil
descriptions: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

156.name: Quilava
descriptions: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

157.name: Typhlosion
descriptions: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

158.name: Totodile
descriptions: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

159.name: Croconaw
descriptions: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

160.name: Feraligatr
descriptions: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

161.name: Sentret
descriptions: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

162.name: Furret
descriptions: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

163.name: Hoothoot
descriptions: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.
It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

164.name: Noctowl
descriptions: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

165.name: Ledyba
descriptions: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.

166.name: Ledian
descriptions: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.
It’s said that the patterns on its back are related to the stars in the night sky, but the details of that relationship remain unclear.

167.name: Spinarak
descriptions: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
With threads from its mouth, it fashions sturdy webs that won’t break even if you set a rock on them.

168.name: Ariados
descriptions: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.
Every night, it wanders around in search of prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing threads before it bites into them with its fangs.

169.name: Crobat
descriptions: This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully. Crobat can fly through cramped caves without needing to slow down.
Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.

170.name: Chinchou
descriptions: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.

171.name: Lanturn
descriptions: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.

172.name: Pichu
descriptions: Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.

173.name: Cleffa
descriptions: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.

174.name: Igglybuff
descriptions: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.
Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.

175.name: Togepi
descriptions: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.
The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

176.name: Togetic
descriptions: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.

177.name: Natu
descriptions: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.

178.name: Xatu
descriptions: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.
They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

179.name: Mareep
descriptions: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.

180.name: Flaaffy
descriptions: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.

181.name: Ampharos
descriptions: When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the ocean’s surface.
The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.

182.name: Bellossom
descriptions: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

183.name: Marill
descriptions: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.
The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.

184.name: Azumarill
descriptions: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

185.name: Sudowoodo
descriptions: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.
Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.

186.name: Politoed
descriptions: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.
At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by letting out cries that sound like shouting.

187.name: Hoppip
descriptions: Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found practically everywhere. This is because the wind carries this species all over the world.
This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.

188.name: Skiploom
descriptions: When the weather grows cold, Skiploom’s flower closes and the Pokémon cannot photosynthesize, so it flies away to warmer regions.
Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon’s head.

189.name: Jumpluff
descriptions: Beware its cotton spores. If you accidentally breathe them in, you’ll be racked with coughs and itchiness.
Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.

190.name: Aipom
descriptions: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.
As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.

191.name: Sunkern
descriptions: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.
It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. Knowing it’s weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.

192.name: Sunflora
descriptions: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.

193.name: Yanma
descriptions: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

194.name: Wooper
descriptions: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.
This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

195.name: Quagsire
descriptions: A dim-witted Pokémon. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head into boats or rocks while swimming.
It has an easygoing nature. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

196.name: Espeon
descriptions: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.
The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.

197.name: Umbreon
descriptions: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

198.name: Murkrow
descriptions: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

199.name: Slowking
descriptions: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.
When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke’s head and unlocked an extraordinary power.

200.name: Misdreavus
descriptions: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

201.name: Unown
descriptions: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

202.name: Wobbuffet
descriptions: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.

203.name: Girafarig
descriptions: Girafarig’s tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon from behind.
Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.

204.name: Pineco
descriptions: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.
It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn’t bother it.

205.name: Forretress
descriptions: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
It’s usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.

206.name: Dunsparce
descriptions: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

207.name: Gligar
descriptions: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

208.name: Steelix
descriptions: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.
It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.

209.name: Snubbull
descriptions: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.
It grows close to others easily and is also easily spoiled. The disparity between its face and its actions makes many young people wild about it.

210.name: Granbull
descriptions: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.
While it has powerful jaws, it doesn’t care for disputes, so it rarely has a chance to display their might.

211.name: Qwilfish
descriptions: Experienced fishers say they try to catch Qwilfish in the brief moment that these Pokémon become defenseless just after launching poisonous spikes.
Be cautious if this Pokémon starts sucking in water—it will soon attack by scattering the toxic spikes that grow all over its body.

212.name: Scizor
descriptions: It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
This Pokémon’s pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

213.name: Shuckle
descriptions: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.
It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

214.name: Heracross
descriptions: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

215.name: Sneasel
descriptions: This is a smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.
This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

216.name: Teddiursa
descriptions: Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon have a smile back on its face.
This Pokémon discreetly follows Combee to find their hive. It scoops up big dollops of honey in its palms to eat.

217.name: Ursaring
descriptions: It is quite skilled at climbing trees. If it comes across a Primeape while searching for berries in the treetops, trouble will surely ensue.
It usually wears a hardened expression, but when it’s licking up honey—which it loves—the joy it feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.

218.name: Slugma
descriptions: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
Molten magma courses throughout Slugma’s circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.

219.name: Magcargo
descriptions: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

Magcargo’s shell is actually its skin that hardened as a result of cooling. Its shell is very brittle and fragile—just touching it causes it to crumble apart. This Pokémon returns to its original size by dipping itself in magma.

220.name: Swinub
descriptions: If it smells something enticing, it dashes off headlong to find the source of the aroma.
It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

221.name: Piloswine
descriptions: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.
If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

222.name: Corsola
descriptions: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.
It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.

223.name: Remoraid
descriptions: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine’s underside to scavenge for leftovers.
The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.

224.name: Octillery
descriptions: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

225.name: Delibird
descriptions: It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.
It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.

226.name: Mantine
descriptions: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.
If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

227.name: Skarmory
descriptions: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.

228.name: Houndour
descriptions: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.
It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

229.name: Houndoom
descriptions: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

230.name: Kingdra
descriptions: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been given to royalty as gifts.
With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokémon will show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra and a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.

231.name: Phanpy
descriptions: It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.
This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won’t be able to settle down unless it washes its body.

232.name: Donphan
descriptions: Donphan is normally a calm Pokémon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.
Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won’t faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.

233.name: Porygon2
descriptions: After artificial intelligence was implemented in Porygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange language that only other Porygon2 understand.
This is a Porygon that was updated with special data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about many different subjects all on its own.

234.name: Stantler
descriptions: It’s said that this Pokémon used to be stronger long ago when it had many enemies, and that it was even able to evolve under its own power.
This Pokémon apparently used to live in much harsher environments, and thus it once had stronger psychic powers than it does now.

235.name: Smeargle
descriptions: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.
The fluid of Smeargle’s tail secretions changes in the intensity of its hue as the Pokémon’s emotions change.

236.name: Tyrogue
descriptions: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.
It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

237.name: Hitmontop
descriptions: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.
It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

238.name: Smoochum
descriptions: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.
If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.

239.name: Elekid
descriptions: It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.

240.name: Magby
descriptions: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.
This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.

241.name: Miltank
descriptions: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.

242.name: Blissey
descriptions: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.
Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey’s egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.

243.name: Raikou
descriptions: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

244.name: Entei
descriptions: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

245.name: Suicune
descriptions: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.
Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

246.name: Larvitar
descriptions: It is born deep underground. It can’t emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.
Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

247.name: Pupitar
descriptions: Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

248.name: Tyranitar
descriptions: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.
Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn’t care about others.

249.name: Lugia
descriptions: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

250.name: Ho-oh
descriptions: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

251.name: Celebi
descriptions: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.
This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

252.name: Treecko
descriptions: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
Treecko has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This Pokémon attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.

253.name: Grovyle
descriptions: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.
The leaves growing out of Grovyle’s body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This Pokémon is a master at climbing trees in jungles.

254.name: Sceptile
descriptions: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.
The leaves growing on Sceptile’s body are very sharp edged. This Pokémon is very agile—it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.

255.name: Torchic
descriptions: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
Torchic sticks with its Trainer, following behind with unsteady steps. This Pokémon breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.

256.name: Combusken
descriptions: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.
Combusken toughens up its legs and thighs by running through fields and mountains. This Pokémon’s legs possess both speed and power, enabling it to dole out 10 kicks in one second.

257.name: Blaziken
descriptions: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.
In battle, Blaziken blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this Pokémon’s wrists burn.

258.name: Mudkip
descriptions: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
The fin on Mudkip’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.

259.name: Marshtomp
descriptions: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.
The surface of Marshtomp’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This Pokémon plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.

260.name: Swampert
descriptions: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
Swampert is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This Pokémon also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

261.name: Poochyena
descriptions: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
At first sight, Poochyena takes a bite at anything that moves. This Pokémon chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

262.name: Mightyena
descriptions: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
Mightyena gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack. It starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body. This Pokémon will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.

263.name: Zigzagoon
descriptions: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.
It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on trees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and calmer than the kind native to Galar.

264.name: Linoone
descriptions: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.
Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes made with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.

265.name: Wurmple
descriptions: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

Using the spikes on its rear end, Wurmple peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This Pokémon’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.

266.name: Silcoon
descriptions: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.
Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pokémon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.

267.name: Beautifly
descriptions: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.
Beautifly’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this Pokémon, just leave a potted flower by an open window. Beautifly is sure to come looking for pollen.

268.name: Cascoon
descriptions: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not forget the pain it endured.

Cascoon makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens. This Pokémon prepares for its evolution inside the cocoon.

269.name: Dustox
descriptions: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.
Dustox is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this Pokémon are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.

270.name: Lotad
descriptions: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

271.name: Lombre
descriptions: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.

272.name: Ludicolo
descriptions: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.

273.name: Seedot
descriptions: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.

274.name: Nuzleaf
descriptions: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.
It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

275.name: Shiftry
descriptions: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.

276.name: Taillow
descriptions: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.

277.name: Swellow
descriptions: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow’s clawed feet, preventing escape.

278.name: Wingull
descriptions: It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.
It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.

279.name: Pelipper
descriptions: It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.
It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.

280.name: Ralts
descriptions: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people’s emotions.

281.name: Kirlia
descriptions: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

282.name: Gardevoir
descriptions: It unleashes psychokinetic energy at full power when protecting a Trainer it has bonded closely with.
To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

283.name: Surskit
descriptions: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.
They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.

284.name: Masquerain
descriptions: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.
It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction—to and fro and sideways.

285.name: Shroomish
descriptions: If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.
It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

286.name: Breloom
descriptions: The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.
It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.

287.name: Slakoth
descriptions: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.

288.name: Vigoroth
descriptions: It is always hungry because it won’t stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it can’t keep still.
Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

289.name: Slaking
descriptions: This Pokémon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.
It is the world’s most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.

290.name: Nincada
descriptions: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.

291.name: Ninjask
descriptions: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.

292.name: Shedinja
descriptions: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.
A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.

293.name: Whismur
descriptions: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.
The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.

294.name: Loudred
descriptions: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.
Loudred’s ears serve as speakers, and they can put out sound waves powerful enough to blow away a house.

295.name: Exploud
descriptions: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.
In the past, people would use the loud voices of these Pokémon as a means of communication between distant cities.

296.name: Makuhita
descriptions: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.

297.name: Hariyama
descriptions: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

298.name: Azurill
