While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

603.name: Eelektrik
descriptions: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

604.name: Eelektross
descriptions: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

605.name: Elgyem
descriptions: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.
If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.

606.name: Beheeyem
descriptions: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.
Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

607.name: Litwick
descriptions: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.

608.name: Lampent
descriptions: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.

609.name: Chandelure
descriptions: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.
This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

610.name: Axew
descriptions: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.
This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.

611.name: Fraxure
descriptions: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.
Because its tusks don’t grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won’t use them unless truly necessary.

612.name: Haxorus
descriptions: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.
This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.

613.name: Cubchoo
descriptions: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, you’ll get frostbite.
Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there’s a chance it is sick.

614.name: Beartic
descriptions: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.
It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.

615.name: Cryogonal
descriptions: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.
Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.

616.name: Shelmet
descriptions: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.

617.name: Accelgor
descriptions: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.

618.name: Stunfisk
descriptions: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.
Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.

619.name: Mienfoo
descriptions: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.

620.name: Mienshao
descriptions: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.

621.name: Druddigon
descriptions: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.

622.name: Golett
descriptions: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.

623.name: Golurk
descriptions: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.
Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.

624.name: Pawniard
descriptions: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.
Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.

625.name: Bisharp
descriptions: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

626.name: Bouffalant
descriptions: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

627.name: Rufflet
descriptions: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.
They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.

628.name: Braviary
descriptions: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

629.name: Vullaby
descriptions: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.

630.name: Mandibuzz
descriptions: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.

631.name: Heatmor
descriptions: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

632.name: Durant
descriptions: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

633.name: Deino
descriptions: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.
It can’t see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.

634.name: Zweilous
descriptions: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.
The two heads do not get along at all. If you don’t give each head the same amount of attention, they’ll begin fighting out of jealousy.

635.name: Hydreigon
descriptions: It’s said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.
Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.

636.name: Larvesta
descriptions: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.
This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.

637.name: Volcarona
descriptions: This Pokémon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heat—it’s in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.
Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.

638.name: Cobalion
descriptions: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.

639.name: Terrakion
descriptions: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

640.name: Virizion
descriptions: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.

641.name: Tornadus
descriptions: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

642.name: Thundurus
descriptions: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

643.name: Reshiram
descriptions: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.
This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

644.name: Zekrom
descriptions: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

645.name: Landorus
descriptions: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

646.name: Kyurem
descriptions: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

647.name: Keldeo
descriptions: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

648.name: Meloetta
descriptions: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

649.name: Genesect
descriptions: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

650.name: Chespin
descriptions: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.
The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

651.name: Quilladin
descriptions: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.
It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

652.name: Chesnaught
descriptions: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

653.name: Fennekin
descriptions: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

654.name: Braixen
descriptions: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

655.name: Delphox
descriptions: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

656.name: Froakie
descriptions: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

657.name: Frogadier
descriptions: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.
It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

658.name: Greninja
descriptions: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

659.name: Bunnelby
descriptions: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

660.name: Diggersby
descriptions: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.
With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.

661.name: Fletchling
descriptions: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.
This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.

662.name: Fletchinder
descriptions: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokémon should enter, it will show them no mercy.
Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.

663.name: Talonflame
descriptions: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.
It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.

664.name: Scatterbug
descriptions: This Pokémon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.
Any poison this Pokémon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. That’s why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.

665.name: Spewpa
descriptions: Spewpa doesn’t live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.
If Rufflet attacks this Pokémon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.

666.name: Vivillon
descriptions: This Pokémon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where flowers bloom.

667.name: Litleo
descriptions: The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.
When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.

668.name: Pyroar
descriptions: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.
The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It’s thanks to them that their pride doesn’t starve.

669.name: Flabébé
descriptions: This Flabébé rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokémon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.
This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.

670.name: Floette
descriptions: This Pokémon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.
This Pokémon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.

671.name: Florges
descriptions: They say that flower gardens created by Florges are constantly showered with a power that can heal both body and spirit.
This Pokémon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.

672.name: Skiddo
descriptions: As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.
Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.

673.name: Gogoat
descriptions: These Pokémon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.
It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.

674.name: Pancham
descriptions: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.
It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.

675.name: Pangoro
descriptions: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

676.name: Furfrou
descriptions: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.
There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.

677.name: Espurr
descriptions: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.
Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.

678.name: Meowstic
descriptions: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.

679.name: Honedge
descriptions: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.
Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.

680.name: Doublade
descriptions: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.
Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.

681.name: Aegislash
descriptions: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.
In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.

682.name: Spritzee
descriptions: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.

683.name: Aromatisse
descriptions: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.
The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.

684.name: Swirlix
descriptions: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.

685.name: Slurpuff
descriptions: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.

686.name: Inkay
descriptions: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.
It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.

687.name: Malamar
descriptions: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.

688.name: Binacle
descriptions: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.
After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

689.name: Barbaracle
descriptions: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.
Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

690.name: Skrelp
descriptions: This Pokémon is a poor swimmer. If it’s caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.
Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.

691.name: Dragalge
descriptions: Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.
Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.

692.name: Clauncher
descriptions: Clauncher’s claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesn’t appeal to all tastes.
This Pokémon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokémon.

693.name: Clawitzer
descriptions: The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.
Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.

694.name: Helioptile
descriptions: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.
When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.

695.name: Heliolisk
descriptions: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

696.name: Tyrunt
descriptions: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.

697.name: Tyrantrum
descriptions: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.

698.name: Amaura
descriptions: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.

699.name: Aurorus
descriptions: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.

700.name: Sylveon
descriptions: Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents’ weak spots.
This Pokémon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.

701.name: Hawlucha
descriptions: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.
Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.

702.name: Dedenne
descriptions: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.
It’s small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people’s homes and charge itself.

703.name: Carbink
descriptions: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.

704.name: Goomy
descriptions: Goomy’s horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomy’s senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.
Most of a Goomy’s body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokémon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.

705.name: Sliggoo
descriptions: When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated—it’ll dissolve anything.
The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.

706.name: Goodra
descriptions: This Pokémon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.
It loves the rain. This mellow Pokémon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.

707.name: Klefki
descriptions: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.
Once it absorbs a key’s metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.

708.name: Phantump
descriptions: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.

709.name: Trevenant
descriptions: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.

710.name: Pumpkaboo
descriptions: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
Spirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.

711.name: Gourgeist
descriptions: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.

712.name: Bergmite
descriptions: Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of −148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.
They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.

713.name: Avalugg
descriptions: This Pokémon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When it’s floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.
As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.

714.name: Noibat
descriptions: Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.
This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.

715.name: Noivern
descriptions: In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokémon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.
Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokémon has a cruel disposition.

716.name: Xerneas
descriptions: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

717.name: Yveltal
descriptions: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

718.name: Zygarde
descriptions: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.

719.name: Diancie
descriptions: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

720.name: Hoopa
descriptions: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.

721.name: Volcanion
descriptions: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

722.name: Rowlet
descriptions: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.
It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

723.name: Dartrix
descriptions: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

724.name: Decidueye
descriptions: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.
It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

725.name: Litten
descriptions: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

726.name: Torracat
descriptions: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.
It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.

727.name: Incineroar
descriptions: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

728.name: Popplio
descriptions: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!
The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

729.name: Brionne
descriptions: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.

730.name: Primarina
descriptions: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.
To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.

731.name: Pikipek
descriptions: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.

732.name: Trumbeak
descriptions: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.

733.name: Toucannon
descriptions: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.

734.name: Yungoos
descriptions: It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.
Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.

735.name: Gumshoos
descriptions: Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesn’t seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.
Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.

736.name: Grubbin
descriptions: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

737.name: Charjabug
descriptions: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.
While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

738.name: Vikavolt
descriptions: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

739.name: Crabrawler
descriptions: If it loses its pincers, they’ll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.
This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.

740.name: Crabominable
descriptions: Though its punches are powerful, this Pokémon’s movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.
The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.

741.name: Oricorio
descriptions: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.
This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.

742.name: Cutiefly
descriptions: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.

743.name: Ribombee
descriptions: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.

744.name: Rockruff
descriptions: This Pokémon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.
This Pokémon is very friendly when it’s young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

745.name: Lycanroc
descriptions: It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.
Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.

746.name: Wishiwashi
descriptions: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.

747.name: Mareanie
descriptions: It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavor—they’re not suitable as food.
This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.

748.name: Toxapex
descriptions: Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.
This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.

749.name: Mudbray
descriptions: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesn’t change even when it’s loaded with 50 times its own body weight.
This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won’t dry out even if it’s exposed to the sun for a long time.

750.name: Mudsdale
descriptions: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.
This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.

751.name: Dewpider
descriptions: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.

752.name: Araquanid
descriptions: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

753.name: Fomantis
descriptions: Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.
Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.

754.name: Lurantis
descriptions: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokémon puts its Trainer’s attentiveness to the test.
By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.

755.name: Morelull
descriptions: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.

756.name: Shiinotic
descriptions: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

757.name: Salandit
descriptions: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.
It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

758.name: Salazzle
descriptions: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each other’s group.
Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.

759.name: Stufful
descriptions: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

760.name: Bewear
descriptions: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

761.name: Bounsweet
descriptions: A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokémon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.
Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled-down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

762.name: Steenee
descriptions: Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.
Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

763.name: Tsareena
descriptions: This Pokémon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.
This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.

764.name: Comfey
descriptions: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.
Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.

765.name: Oranguru
descriptions: This Pokémon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.
People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.

766.name: Passimian
descriptions: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.
This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won’t obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.

767.name: Wimpod
descriptions: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.
It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.

768.name: Golisopod
descriptions: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.
It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

769.name: Sandygast
descriptions: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while they’re blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.
If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else—like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

770.name: Palossand
descriptions: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.
The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.

771.name: Pyukumuku
descriptions: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.
It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

772.name: Type: Null
descriptions: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.

773.name: Silvally
descriptions: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.

774.name: Minior
descriptions: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.

775.name: Komala
descriptions: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komala’s drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.
Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.

776.name: Turtonator
descriptions: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.
Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

777.name: Togedemaru
descriptions: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

778.name: Mimikyu
descriptions: Mimikyu was only recently identified as a Pokémon. Previously, people thought it was just a ghost wearing a cloth.
This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.

779.name: Bruxish
descriptions: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.
It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.

780.name: Drampa
descriptions: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

781.name: Dhelmise
descriptions: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.
After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

782.name: Jangmo-o
descriptions: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.
They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.

783.name: Hakamo-o
descriptions: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.
The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.

784.name: Kommo-o
descriptions: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.

785.name: Tapu Koko
descriptions: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

786.name: Tapu Lele
descriptions: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.

787.name: Tapu Bulu
descriptions: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.
Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

788.name: Tapu Fini
descriptions: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

789.name: Cosmog
descriptions: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.
Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.

790.name: Cosmoem
descriptions: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.

791.name: Solgaleo
descriptions: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”
Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.

792.name: Lunala
descriptions: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”

793.name: Nihilego
descriptions: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.

794.name: Buzzwole
descriptions: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

795.name: Pheromosa
descriptions: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.

796.name: Xurkitree
descriptions: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

797.name: Celesteela
descriptions: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.

798.name: Kartana
descriptions: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

799.name: Guzzlord
descriptions: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

800.name: Necrozma
descriptions: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.
It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.

801.name: Magearna
descriptions: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

802.name: Marshadow
descriptions: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.
It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.

803.name: Poipole
descriptions: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

804.name: Naganadel
descriptions: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.

805.name: Stakataka
descriptions: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

806.name: Blacephalon
descriptions: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.
It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

807.name: Zeraora
descriptions: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

808.name: Meltan
descriptions: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

809.name: Melmetal
descriptions: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.

810.name: Grookey
descriptions: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

811.name: Thwackey
descriptions: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.
The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

812.name: Rillaboom
descriptions: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

813.name: Scorbunny
descriptions: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.

814.name: Raboot
descriptions: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

815.name: Cinderace
descriptions: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

816.name: Sobble
descriptions: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.

817.name: Drizzile
descriptions: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

818.name: Inteleon
descriptions: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

819.name: Skwovet
descriptions: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.
It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.

820.name: Greedent
descriptions: This Pokémon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.
If it spots a berry tree, it will immediately go to gather berries without a sideways glance—even if it’s in the middle of a battle.

821.name: Rookidee
descriptions: The females are fussier than the males. If another creature dirties a female Rookidee’s wings, it’ll peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.
This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee’s eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.

822.name: Corvisquire
descriptions: This intelligent Pokémon will quickly learn how to use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.
It’s said that the reason behind Corvisquire’s high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokémon.

823.name: Corviknight
descriptions: Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokémon flies through the skies with ease.
Corviknight can’t serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokémon’s natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.

824.name: Blipbug
descriptions: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.

825.name: Dottler
descriptions: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.

826.name: Orbeetle
descriptions: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.
It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.

827.name: Nickit
descriptions: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

828.name: Thievul
descriptions: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

829.name: Gossifleur
descriptions: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

830.name: Eldegoss
descriptions: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.

831.name: Wooloo
descriptions: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

832.name: Dubwool
descriptions: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

833.name: Chewtle
descriptions: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.
Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another Chewtle’s horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.

834.name: Drednaw
descriptions: Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.
Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokémon has an extremely vicious disposition.

835.name: Yamper
descriptions: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

836.name: Boltund
descriptions: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

837.name: Rolycoly
descriptions: Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon’s body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.
On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.

838.name: Carkol
descriptions: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkol’s back never falls apart, even when the Pokémon rolls around at high speeds.
The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.

839.name: Coalossal
descriptions: It’s gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.
To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.

840.name: Applin
descriptions: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokémon grows weak.
It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apple’s skin and prevent it from rotting.

841.name: Flapple
descriptions: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.
It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponent’s guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.

842.name: Appletun
descriptions: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletun’s back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.
It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.

843.name: Silicobra
descriptions: Silicobra’s large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokémon is not very good at telling apart different smells.
Silicobra’s neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.

844.name: Sandaconda
descriptions: The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandaconda’s saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.
It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.

845.name: Cramorant
descriptions: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

846.name: Arrokuda
descriptions: It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokuda’s eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.
Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.

847.name: Barraskewda
descriptions: It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.
It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the water’s surface.

848.name: Toxel
descriptions: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.
It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel’s body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.

849.name: Toxtricity
descriptions: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.
Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.

850.name: Sizzlipede
descriptions: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

851.name: Centiskorch
descriptions: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.
When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

852.name: Clobbopus
descriptions: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.
It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

853.name: Grapploct
descriptions: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

854.name: Sinistea
descriptions: Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.
The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.

855.name: Polteageist
descriptions: These Pokémon multiply by creeping into teapots and pouring themselves into leftover tea.
The tea that composes Polteageist’s body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.

856.name: Hatenna
descriptions: It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.
Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokémon prefers environments where no other creatures live.

857.name: Hattrem
descriptions: The moment this Pokémon finds someone who’s emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.
To this Pokémon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noises—even if the emotions are happy ones.

858.name: Hatterene
descriptions: Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterene’s territory.
Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.

859.name: Impidimp
descriptions: They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.
The reason this Pokémon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it can’t absorb negative emotions.

860.name: Morgrem
descriptions: This Pokémon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. It’s popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.
Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesn’t have confidence in its brawn.

861.name: Grimmsnarl
descriptions: It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasn’t given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.
This Pokémon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.

862.name: Obstagoon
descriptions: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

863.name: Perrserker
descriptions: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

864.name: Cursola
descriptions: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.

865.name: Sirfetch'd
descriptions: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

866.name: Mr. Rime
descriptions: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

867.name: Runerigus
descriptions: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

868.name: Milcery
descriptions: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

869.name: Alcremie
descriptions: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.

870.name: Falinks
descriptions: The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when it’s time to change formation.
The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.

871.name: Pincurchin
descriptions: This Pokémon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.
This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.

872.name: Snom
descriptions: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.
It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.

873.name: Frosmoth
descriptions: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.
Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.

874.name: Stonjourner
descriptions: This Pokémon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.
The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokémon’s habitat.

875.name: Eiscue
descriptions: If you lick the ice covering its face, you’ll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.
On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.

876.name: Indeedee
descriptions: This Pokémon never leaves its Trainer’s side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.
This Pokémon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.

877.name: Morpeko
descriptions: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.

878.name: Cufant
descriptions: Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokémon feed.
Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.

879.name: Copperajah
descriptions: Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokémon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.
This Pokémon was brought to Paldea long ago by people from a faraway land. It’s so strong that it can easily pull an airplane.

880.name: Dracozolt
descriptions: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

881.name: Arctozolt
descriptions: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

882.name: Dracovish
descriptions: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.
Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

883.name: Arctovish
descriptions: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.
Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

884.name: Duraludon
descriptions: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

885.name: Dreepy
descriptions: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn’t feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.
In the evening, groups of Dreepy will fly at high speeds over the ocean and poke at Pokémon in the water for fun.

886.name: Drakloak
descriptions: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they’re all grown up.
This Pokémon flies around at over 120 miles per hour. If a Drakloak is defeated in a battle, its Dreepy will wander off without a second thought.

887.name: Dragapult
descriptions: The fastest Dragapult of the group is always surrounded by Dreepy that want to fly at sonic speed.
